title: YouTube Community Guidelines enforcement – Google Transparency Report
content:
# YouTube Community Guidelines Enforcement Report

YouTube publishes detailed Community Guidelines Enforcement Reports quarterly, showing video removal statistics, policy violations, and actions taken.

## Key 2023 Stats
- Videos Removed: ~151 million (H1: 58M; H2: 93M)
- Channels Terminated: ~10 million
- Proactive Detection Rate: 94%+
- Views on Later-Removed Videos: ~2.5 billion (<0.1% of total)

## Top Violation Categories
- Spam/Deceptive Practices: ~120 million (80% of removals)
- Child Safety/CSAM: ~5.2 million (3.5%)
- Violent/Graphic Content: ~8 million (5%)
- Hate Speech: ~3 million (2%)
- Harassment: ~2.5 million (1.5%)
- Nudity/Sexual: ~2 million (1.5%)

## Machine Learning Integration
- 98%+ proactive detection for major categories
- AI-assisted ranking and prioritization
- Multi-modal models for images/video/text
- ~25 million appeals filed; 11% overturned

## Transparency
- Quarterly reports available at transparencyreport.google.com
- Interactive dashboard with geographic breakdowns
- Focus on spam grew significantly in 2023 with Shorts enforcement
